content: In Greek mythology, which Titan is known for holding up the celestial heavens on his shoulders as a punishment from Zeus?

In Greek mythology, the Titan known for holding up the celestial heavens on his shoulders as a punishment from Zeus is Atlas. Atlas was one of the Titans who fought against the Olympian gods in the Titanomachy. After the Olympians emerged victorious, Zeus condemned Atlas to hold up the heavens as a punishment for his role in the war. This story has become a famous myth and is often referenced in literature and popular culture.
